{"step_by_step_thinking": "Catatonia is a neuropsychiatric syndrome characterized by a range of motor abnormalities. To determine which of the options is not a part of catatonia, we need to understand the different motor abnormalities associated with catatonia. Akathisia refers to a subjective feeling of restlessness and an urge to move. Ambivalence refers to the coexistence of conflicting emotions or attitudes towards a particular situation. Ambitendency refers to the simultaneous presence of opposing impulses or desires. Akinesia refers to a lack of voluntary movement. Based on this information, the motor abnormality that is not a part of catatonia is Ambivalence.", "answer_choice": "B"}
